channel.title: ♪♪ How Do You Make A Client ♪♪
channel.description:
Okay, the reason why I want to make a client, is because I've seen a lot of client's that was really cool, and so I really want to make and if anyone could please post the direct links for me to make a client that would be really helpful thanks.
Thanks,Colgi thanks for posting! [center][img]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/Themes/default/images/warnwarn.gif[/img] This section is for the development of servers, this can be helping someone with a problem they have with their [b]server[/b] or posting code snippets to improve [b]servers[/b], nothing else.[/center]

item.title: ♪♪ How Do You Make A Client ♪♪
item.dc:creator: @adog17x adog17x
item.description:
@adog17x wrote:

======================================================================
Ok well now that Gliomaru is gone, I’m here to pick up from where he left.
In this tutorial you will learn how to create an elemental sprite. But you can use these techniques to create other forms of magic sprites.

First things first, you will need one of these programs:

-Paint
-Graphics Gale
-Adobe Photoshop (CS2/CS3)

I would highly recommend graphics gale, as you learn more on how to create your own effects, and it is the most ideal for creating sprites. But if you want to use photoshop, or paint, I’m not holding you back.

You can download graphics gale here

Ok, now I will post pictures later, but for now I will just write the basic steps, then finish off the rest later. Lets get started shall we.

NOTE: The parts in red, are showing you where or what is happening.

Alrighty, now, think of what sprite you want to make. In this tutorial we will be focusing on a basic magic icon. The magic icon will be a wave spell. Preferably air wave. To get started find the air wave sprite, and open it up with photoshop, paint or graphics gale. I’m not too sure of the dimensions now, but I will get them later. What you want to do, is have a look at my air wave. Now tell me what you see. Glio rated this as a perfect air wave which beat his air wave. I used a different form of creating this sprite, which is a bit more advanced than just using a gradient. But we all have different opinions. So…what do you see, look at it for 5 minutes, and then erase everything on the one you editted.

Take out a 1 pixel pencil, zoom right in. If paint, go 8x, graphics gale, 2000, photoshop 1600. This will provide you more freedom and it’s about 100x times more easier to make the sprite. Now with the 1 px pencil, draw about 20 designs, and pick whichever one you think is the best. What you want to look for is a good structure, and a good representation of the wave spell. But, make the sprite fat at first, and make sure it has a tail at the end of it.

Now that you have your chosen design, take a light grey and chose your light source. Preferably for the wave sprite, the lightest part would be right at the head.
http://i198.photobucket.com/albums/aa265/adrian_Gerard/2-Idrewitinthere.png
Start with the light grey going right across the tip of the head, and do another line of it.
Now, open up the colour choser. You do this by double clicking the colour palete you have chosen.

Pick a colour, slightly darker than the previous colour. And repeat the last few steps.
http://i198.photobucket.com/albums/aa265/adrian_Gerard/3.png
Keep repeating those steps. until you’re close to the start of the tail. What you want to do now, is keep that colour you have right now, and make a border on the inside of the tail.

Go right to the tip of the tail, and get a slightly darker colour, and colour a few pixels around the tip fo the tail.

Gradually get lighter as your work your way back up the tail, and then you should have the basic wave form.

Now, it’s time to learn a technique that was taught to me. Which is called trimming. (No, not the scams on runescape ). Trimming will get the sprite ready to be transformed. You can use trimming if you feel the sprite is too fat. But in this case, trimming is best used for a form of energy. Since the sprite is fat, I will show you how to make it look more like a wave.

What you do, is get a 1 px brush, and start going around the outside of the sprite, to make it more slim. Like this:

Always keep your fingers on the Ctrl + Z combination, to undo any mistakes you make.
Now that you have trimmed it, erase around the middle of it. Like this:

This will give you room to create more of the sprite. Now since the wave has energy in it. You want room to have another one more tail, which will curve over one tail.
Example:

Now just create a border to guide you where you will create the second tail. And then find the colour which is closest to the start of that second tail, and fill in one line of colour.

And keep repeating the steps which ask you to make it lighter and lighter, until you hit the tail, in which you will make the end of it darker. THe steps are the underlined bits.
Now, you should be making some progress and be near finishing.

Finally, you should add any extras to the sprite which you feel is necessary.

And that’s how to create a magic sprite. Remember, these techniques can be used to create other magic sprites, but you need to be a bit more creative to do so. Enjoy for now, and I will upload the pictures in a few hours.

Read full topic
item.source: ♪♪ How Do You Make A Client ♪♪

item.title: ♪♪ How Do You Make A Client ♪♪
item.dc:creator: @adog17x adog17x
item.description:
@adog17x wrote:

[QUOTE=Kyle;239994][CENTER][SIZE=7][COLOR=red][FONT=Hotdog][COLOR=blue]Start[/COLOR] Your [COLOR=blue]Client[/COLOR] V5[/FONT][/COLOR][/SIZE][/CENTER]


Step 1
Firstly You’re Gonna Need A Client:

csk :
Csk
Credits: S W A T

TheClientv1:
TheClientV1
Credits: Jukk

Step 2:
Ok Now You Have The Client Lets Start Editing The Hell Out Of It!

Step 2(i):
OK Lets Change The Name Of The Client To Yours
Now Open Up [COLOR=orange]Client.Java[/COLOR] Then Search For The Clients Name For Example “Endar” Then Change It To “Your Servers Name”

Step 2(ii):
Editing Textures

Now Open [COLOR=orange]Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub3[/COLOR] And Search For:

public static final int[] method371(int i)Now Add This Directly Below That Method

if (i == **) { i = ##; }Ok The ** Stands For The Texture And The ## Stands For The Object And Just Change That To What Ever You Want
[COLOR=red]Example:[/COLOR]

if (i == 40) { i = 35; }The 40 Stand For Lava.
The 35 Stand For The Walls.

Texture List

* 50 suggests the end of the textures... * 49 = Something to do with 48, I assume * 48 = Hyroglyphs? * 47 = Extremely light wall colour... * 46 = Ground in varrock by the fountain * 45 = Door * 44 = Similar to 43; Darker * 43 = Buildings' stone wall * 42 = Sold blue, for those flowers in Varrock I believe * 41 = Bushes of some sort * 40 = lava * 39 = Painting of an elf * 38 = One of the new Falador textures * 37 = Same as 38 * 36 = Door or floor texture? * 35 = New Falador walls * 34 = Magic tree stars * 33 = Maple tree leaves * 32 = Sand maybe? * 31 = Another lava overlay * 30 = Yew tree overlays * 29 = Sort of like fern leaves :\ * 28 = ??????????????????????? * 27 = Snake skin * 26 = Spider webs * 25 = Water of some sort, I think * 24 = Flowing water * 23 = Dark buidling siding (something near Lumbridge I think?) * 22 = Wooden floor * 21 = Roofing maybe? * 20 = Book case * 19 = Something with.. holes.. * 18 = Sand..or..something? * 17 = Water found water * 16 = Wooden roof I think. * 15 = Looks like an overlay for water? * 14 = Portrait of a king * 13 = Landscape of mountains * 12 = Bars on those jail doors, etc * 11 = Runecrafting altar \ mysterious rune texture * 10 = Solid blue... * 9 = Tree stumps * 8 = Tree leaves * 7 = Um.. Logs or something? * 6 = Red roofing * 5 = Really dark wood texture * 4 = Elven doors * 3 = Wooden flooring * 2 = Stone walls (i.e. on Varrock banks, etc) * 1 = Water * 0 = Door **/Step2(iii):

Ok Were Nearly Finished.
Now Lets Make A Background For Out Client Shall We.

Ok Firstly Get A Good Background Image Then Open Up Paint.
Make Sure Your Name Is On It Thats The Main Thing!

Ok So You Have Your Image Ready Make Sure The Dimensions Are 766 by 503
Now You Must Flip It.
How To Flip It The Proper Way:
Right Click And Hold From The Bottom Right Corner Of The Image, Then Go To The Middle Until The Numbers At The Bottom Say 383 by 503, Then Right Click And Flip Then Press Ok.

Outcome:

projectwave-1.jpg768×512

Change the name of the image to your server then save It in the same folder as your client.
Now Open:
[COLOR=orange]Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1[/COLOR]
And search for this

Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit()After that you should,

.getImage("[COLOR=blue]THECLIENTNAME[/COLOR].jpg")Change the “Filename” To your server name, Notice this might be differant.
[COLOR=red]Example: [/COLOR]Change

.getImage("Endar.jpg")to

.getImage("YOURSERVERNAME.jpg")Make Sure You Have The Same Name As The Picture You Put In The Client Or It WOnt Work

========================================================================================================================================================
[SIZE=7][COLOR=Red]Tutorials[/COLOR][/SIZE]

ok now you might want to add some models in so you can add this in: this tut is frugooscape’s way

Ok ALL of this tut is in Class8.java

Ok find

anIntArray195 = new int[anInt203];And make it

anIntArray195 = new int[anInt203+frugooItems];ok next find

class8.method203(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_183);And under that add

if(i == 7621){ class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.anIntArray156 = new int[1]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int [1]; //Purple: 926-127 class8.anIntArray156[0] = 926; class8.anIntArray160[0] = 128; class8.anInt174 = 2635;//Item Look class8.anInt181 = 440; class8.anInt190 = 76; class8.anInt198 = 1850; class8.anInt204 = 0; class8.anInt169 = 1; class8.anInt194 = 1; class8.anInt165 = 187; class8.anInt200 = 363; class8.anInt175 = 29; class8.anInt197 = 87; class8.aString170 = "Black Party Hat"; class8.aByteArray178 = "A Black Party Hat".getBytes(); }And in class8 declare this

public static int frugooItems = 5;===========================================================

now this way is kevin & james:
Here are some useful tools

Defyboys Cache Extractor
Bentskis Model Viewer

Extact a new client’s cache and find the model you’d like to add to your own client. You can view them with model viewer.

Step One:

Open up client.java and find:

String s = aString887.toLowerCase();Under that add:

if(s.startsWith("add model")) { try { int ModelIndex = Integer.parseInt(s.substring(10)); byte[] abyte0 = GetModel(ModelIndex); if(abyte0 != null && abyte0.length > 0){ aClass14Array970[1].method234(abyte0.length, abyte0, (byte)2, ModelIndex); method77("Model: ["+ModelIndex+"] added successfully!", 0, "", aBoolean991); }else{ method77("Unable to find the model. "+ModelIndex, 0, "", aBoolean991); } } catch(Exception e) { method77("Syntax - ::add model <path>", 0, "", aBoolean991);} }Now search for

public final void method74(int i, int j, int k)And above that add:

public byte[] GetModel(int Index) { try { File Model = new File("./Models/"+Index+".gz"); byte[] aByte = new byte[(int)Model.length()]; FileInputStream Fis = new FileInputStream(Model); Fis.read(aByte); method77("aByte = ["+aByte+"]!", 0, "", aBoolean991); Fis.close(); return aByte; } catch(Exception e) {return null;} }Replace your class42_sub1 with the one attached.

Now how to add the models:

Step two:

Download the GZIP installer from HERE

Once installed navigate to C:/Program Files/GnuWin32/bin

Step three:

Copy the file you want to GZIP into that folder then click Start > Run > CMD

Type in

cd c:\Program Files\GnuWin32\binType in gzip filetozip.mdlType in exitCopy the file that you just GZIPPED into your client folder and make sure it is named modelid.gz (remove the .mdl part from the name in other words)

Step four:

In this example we are replacing the partyhat model with a skill cape one so that when you wear a party hat you will wear a skill cape instead (you can obviously change this)

Get the model of the skill cape you want to use (i am using model # 18985) and compress it into .gz format using the method above. Rename the file 187 (we rename it to 187 because that is the model id of a party hat being worn). Put the file (now called 187.gz) into the models folder which should be in the same place as your client (the structure looks like this ./clientfolder/Models) and run the client. Once logged in type in:

add model 187 Close the client and restart it. Spawn ANY partyhat and wear it I hope you like range capes .

Use the above method for other items (you can work out how to do it

==========================================================

now for moving firecapes

open client.java
search for [34] (it should be inside method37)

you should see:

[code](Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub3.anIntArray1480[34] >= j)
{
Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2 class30_sub2_sub1_sub2_2 = Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub3.aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Arra y1474[34];
int i1 = class30_sub2_sub1_sub2_2.anInt1452 * class30_sub2_sub1_sub2_2.anInt1453 - 1;
int l1 = class30_sub2_sub1_sub2_2.anInt1452 * anInt945 * 2;
byte abyte2[] = class30_sub2_sub1_sub2_2.aByteArray1450;
byte abyte5[] = aByteArray912;
for(int k2 = 0; k2 <= i1; k2++)
abyte5[k2] = abyte2[k2 - l1 & i1];

class30_sub2_sub1_sub2_2.aByteArray1450 = abyte5;
aByteArray912 = abyte2;
Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub3.method370(34, -477);
}[/code]above or below that add this:

[code](Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub3.anIntArray1480[40] >= j)//fire cape firecape
{
Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2 class30_sub2_sub1_sub2_2 = Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub3.aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2Arra y1474[40];
int i1 = class30_sub2_sub1_sub2_2.anInt1452 * class30_sub2_sub1_sub2_2.anInt1453 - 1;
int l1 = class30_sub2_sub1_sub2_2.anInt1452 * anInt945 * 2;
byte abyte2[] = class30_sub2_sub1_sub2_2.aByteArray1450;
byte abyte5[] = aByteArray912;
for(int k2 = 0; k2 <= i1; k2++)
abyte5[k2] = abyte2[k2 - l1 & i1];

class30_sub2_sub1_sub2_2.aByteArray1450 = abyte5;
aByteArray912 = abyte2;
Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub3.method370(40, -477);
}[/code]=======================================================

=======================================

well rs2 has now made it diff colours like 10m+ = green, 100k+ = white so here is code
(this also makes any other item go the colours the money does

before the code here is creds

70% me
30% james (for releasing his so i could make mine)

search for aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1270.method385(0, method43(-33245, k10)once you found it hilight it and replace with:

int k10 = class9_1.anIntArray252[i3];// aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1270.method385(0, method43(-33245, k10), j6 + 10 + j7, 822, k5 + 1 + k6);// if(k10 > 99999 && k10 < 10000000 ){// aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1270.method385(0xFFFFFF, method43(-33245, k10), j6 + 9 + j7, 822, k5 + k6);}// else if(k10 > 9999999){// aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1270.method385(0x00ff80, method43(-33245, k10), j6 + 9 + j7, 822, k5 + k6);}// else{// aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1270.method385(0xFFFF00, method43(-33245, k10), j6 + 9 + j7, 822, k5 + k6);} } } } else save,compile,run
and that should be it

picture:

hereugo.jpg725×337

==================================================================
Please note all this is in the [COLOR=Red]Client Class[/COLOR]

Declare This:

private Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1 CustomMapback;Now under the Nullifier Method ([COLOR=YellowGreen]Method8[/COLOR]) Add:

CustomMapback = null;Now Under the DrawMinimap Method (Method79), Find “aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2_1197.method361(0, 16083, 0);” and Replace it with “CustomMapback.method348(0, 16083, 0);”

Now Under the Startup Method ([COLOR=YellowGreen]Method6[/COLOR]) Find “method13(80, (byte)4, “Unpacking Media”);”

and where it says “aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2_1197 = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2(class44_2, “mapback”, 0);” Declare a new sprite with this code:

CustomMapback = new Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1(class44_2, "mapback", 0);Now, This part is only if you have a diffrent mapback, than the 317 mapback!

Find the MinimapDrawing Method ([COLOR=YellowGreen]Method141[/COLOR]) and you will see:

class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.method354(aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2_1197, false, 83 - l1 - class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.anInt1445 / 2 - 4, ((94 + k1) - class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.anInt1444 / 2) + 4); return; } else { class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.method348(((94 + k1) - class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.anInt1444 / 2) + 4, 16083, 83 - l1 - class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.anInt1445 / 2 - 4); return; Replace that with this:

class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.method354(aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2_1197, false, 83 - l1 - class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.anInt1445 / 2 - 4, ((94 + k1) - class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.anInt1444 / 2) + 4); CustomMapback.method348(0, 16083, 0); return; } else { class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.method348(((94 + k1) - class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.anInt1444 / 2) + 4, 16083, 83 - l1 - class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.anInt1445 / 2 - 4); CustomMapback.method348(0, 16083, 0); return; And all you have to do is create a Pixelgrab for the Sprite in the sprite class (Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1)

CREDITS TO IMPULSER!!!

Difficulty: 1/10
Anti leech? No
Description To add Hp Above heads (like moparscape).
Classes modified: client.java

Open client.java.

Add this to client.java,

public boolean hp = true; now under

if(((Class30_Sub2_Sub4_Sub1) (obj)).anInt1532 > anInt1161) { method127(true, ((Class30_Sub2_Sub4_Sub1) (obj)), ((Class30_Sub2_Sub4_Sub1) (obj)).anInt1507 + 15); if(anInt963 > -1) {add

if(hp == true) aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method382(0xff0000, anInt963, -918, (new StringBuilder()).append(((Class30_Sub2_Sub4_Sub1)(Class30_Sub2_Sub4_Sub1)obj).anInt1533).append("/").append(((Class30_Sub2_Sub4_Sub1)(Class30_Sub2_Sub4_Sub1)obj).anInt1534).toString(), anInt964 - 9, true);Credit to moparisthebest for making it

==========================================
in your clients client.java look for

if(anInt1104 != 0) { int j = anInt1104 / 50; int l = j / 60; j %= 60; if(j < 10) aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1271.method385(0xFF3333, "System update in: " + l + ":0" + j, 329, 822, 4); else aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1271.method385(0xFF3333, "System update in: " + l + ":" + j, 329, 822, 4); anInt849++; if(anInt849 > 75) { anInt849 = 0; aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.method397((byte)6, 148); } } } above if(anInt1104 != 0) add

if(nearby) //by pk3r { int pplnearby = anInt891; // players nearby int npcsnearby = anInt836; // monsters nearby aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1271.method385(0xFF3333, "Players Nearby: " + pplnearby, 297, 822, 4); aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1271.method385(0xFFFFFF, "Monsters Nearby: " + npcsnearby, 313, 822, 4); } next find

[code]

        {       
            int i1 = c / 2 - 80;
            int l1 = c1 / 2 + 50;
            aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2_967.method361(i1 - 73, 16083, l1 - 20);
            aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method382(0xffffff, i1, anInt939, "Login", l1 + 5, true);

[/code]make it look like this

int i1 = c / 2 - 80; int l1 = c1 / 2 + 50; aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2_967.method361(i1 - 73, 16083, l1 - 20); aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method382(0xffffff, i1, anInt939, "Login", l1 + 5, true); nearby = true; final look for

private int anInt822; private static byte aByte823 = 77; private long aLong824; private int anIntArrayArray825[][]; add

public static boolean nearby; to that list and your done =p

Purpose: To make you censor system work by censoring the words whilst they are typed!

Difficulty: -3

Procedure:

Step One:

In client.java find:

public final void method73(int i)

Under the { add:

for(int james = 0; james < badWords.length; james++) { String bad = badWords[james]; if(aString887.contains(bad)) aString887 = aString887.replaceAll(badWords[james], "***"); }

Now declare the following:

public String badWords[] = {"word1", "word2", "word3"};

Add in your own bad words. I cannot post them here because they will be blocked lol. If you have a brain then you can make the words load from the internet

Add

	else if (s.equalsIgnoreCase("headicons_prayer") && i == 6)
{
try
{

				Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage(new URL("http://xlinescape.890m.com/pictures%20kb/headicons_prayer%206.png"));	

				anIntArray1439 = new int[anInt1440 * anInt1441];
				PixelGrabber pixelgrabber = new PixelGrabber(image, 0, 0, anInt1440, anInt1441, anIntArray1439, 0, anInt1440);
				pixelgrabber.grabPixels();
System.out.println(s+" "+i+".png"+ " Skulls Loaded");
			}
			catch (Exception exception)
			{
				System.out.println(((Object) (exception)));
			}
}

item.dc:creator: @Colgi Colgi
item.description:
@Colgi wrote:

Okay, the reason why I want to make a client, is because I’ve seen a lot of client’s that was really cool, and so
I really want to make and if anyone could please post the direct links for me to make a client that would be
really helpful thanks.

                                               Thanks,Colgi

thanks for posting!
[center] This section is for the development of servers, this can be helping someone with a problem they have with their server or posting code snippets to improve servers, nothing else.[/center]

item.source: ♪♪ How Do You Make A Client ♪♪
